title: AAQ: Is It Okay to Chant Without Mala or While Wearing Shoes? | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Simply by doing this, the forest fire which is burning our heart of repeated birth and death within this material world will be vanquished and we will be able to see everything properly in full enlightenment with self-realization that I am not the body, I am spirit-soul.
segments.summary: Chanting the holy name of Krishna is a merciful gift that cleanses the heart, leading to self-realization and liberation from the cycle of birth and death.

segments.key_quote: There is no rule and regulation to be followed in chanting Krishna's holy name. Anywhere and everywhere, all the time, 24 bar 7. You can chant Krishna's holy name.
segments.summary: Krishna's holy name possesses all of His power, and there are no restrictions on when or where it can be chanted.

segments.key_quote: Although chanting Hare Krishna has no rule and regulation, what it means is, I have, there is no rule and regulation for chanting Hare Krishna, but if I want rapid progress in spiritual life by chanting Hare Krishna, I should chant a minimum fixed number of times every day without fail.
segments.summary: While there are no strict rules for chanting, a fixed number of rounds chanted daily is recommended for rapid spiritual progress.

segments.key_quote: And Prabhupada said, the basic qualification, the basic number of rounds that we all have to chant is minimum 16 malas of Hare Krishna Maha Mantra every day.
segments.summary: Chanting a fixed number of rounds, specifically 16 malas, is like exercising to develop muscles, and using a mala helps keep track of the count to maintain the vow.
